name: BIKE AMBULANCE AFRICA
description: Designed by Scott Meleskie 18" x 24" 2-color hand-pulled silkscreen print Signed and Numbered by the artist Limited run of 30 ALL PROCEEDS FROM SALE OF PRINT ARE GOING TO RAISE MONEY FOR THE PURCHASE OF BICYCLE AMBULANCES IN BURKINA FASO. IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE STARLEY ROVER SOCIETY, THE CMA, THE CMF AND UNITERRA - WE ARE RAISING MONEY TO PROVIDE BIKE AMBULANCES TO THOSE IN NEED, AND WE WILL BE DELIVERING THE BIKES IN PERSON THIS JANUARY. PLEASE SUPPORT! Follow the event Donate to the cause Prints will be available on November 15th Local pickup preferred, but will ship after the event.

name: STEVEN HARRINGTON x LIMITEDHYPE
description: 18"x24" 5 color silkscreen print SPECKLETONE Cream - Cordtone paper Signed and Numbered by the artist Limited run of 100 prints About Steven Harrington: Steven Harrington lives and works in Los Angeles, CA. Aside from co-owning and operating National Forest Design, he still finds time to work on both commissioned and self-inspired art projects of his own. Influenced by images, fashion and graphics discovered in Time Life Encyclopedias from 1965-1972, thrift stores, and The Moody Blues, his art might be termed contextual objectivism. That is, he views each piece he creates as a tangible object that is part and parcel of a larger context; the object helps define the context and the context helps define the object. Whatever feel or meaning the observer takes away from the piece belongs to the observer. Nothing is shoved down his or her throat. Discovery is the key. Some of his most recent projects include a three board, custom-shaped signature series for Element Skateboards, contributions to the French clothing line Sixpack France, a collaboration with Nike SB, contributions to Arkitip Magazine, a special 3-d piece with Kidrobot, a series of silkscreen prints based on the idea of “connectivity” and most recently, a limited edition print for The Savile. He has exhibited work in Los Angeles, New York, Paris, Berlin, Milan, Barcelona, Tokyo, San Francisco, Chicago, Philadelphia, Montreal, Melbourne and Dallas.
